quizzes.question_text:
Fill in the blank so that the multiplication and division sentences both describe the model.
3 x 3 = 9
9 ÷ 3 = _
solution: The multiplication sentence 3 x 3 = 9 describes the model. The model has 3 groups of 3 dots. There are 9 dots in all.

A division sentence can also describe the model. The 9 dots are divided into 3 equal groups. There are 3 dots in each group. A division sentence that describes the model is: 9 ÷ 3 = 3. Relate the multiplication and division sentences. The multiplication and division sentences describe the same model. So, the same numbers appear in both sentences.
quizzes.backend_description: Three circles arranged horizontally, each containing 3 golden/orange dots arranged diagonally. Each circle represents a group, showing a total of 3 groups with 3 dots in each group, illustrating the concept of 3 × 3 = 9 and supporting the division concept 9 ÷ 3 = 3.
